Name: Story Puzzle: Das kleine böse Puzzle
Description: Help urgently needed! The little bad Puzzle was cursed in the laboratory of the great warlock Magnus Myst! By whom? It can no longer remember! Only his last memory lies scattered in 200 pieces before the children. They first have to puzzle them together! And then? Then tricky puzzles must be solved, dangerous secrets uncovered and the little bad puzzle freed from the curse. This interactive puzzle adventure is not for the faint of heart! Do the children dare to help the little bad Puzzle? For fearless children from 8 and fans the perfect birthday gift!

Name: Malki
Description:
The basic game is played with 2 or 4. The game for advanced players can be played with 2, 3 or 4 players. The Malki game is best served with 4 colors.

The objective of the game is to conquer the Center of the board with your King. Each player disposes of 9 pieces on the board (and 4 spare pieces), representing The King, the watchmen (guards), the warlords and the sorcerer.

Malki is a game of magic that reveals more and more of its depth as you play it. Mind-marvelling.

Name: Tricky Dicks: The Richard Measuring Contest
Description:
The adult card game about describing your Richards. How do you decide Victory? By claiming to have the Longest, Shortest, Thickest, or Thinnest picture of Richard in your hand. Any Challengers? Whip out the ruler card and see which Richard is best! No matter what party you're in, Tricky Dicks will fit right in.

Go around in a circle playing cards and claiming if you have the biggest, smallest, thickets, or thinnest and compare with your opponents. Most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire Card Game
Description:
Put Yourself in the hot seat of one of the nation's favourite quiz shows and take on the iconic money ladder. Using your wits and four lifelines, can you handle the pressure and climb to £1 million?

—description from the publisher

Name: Robot Wrangler
Description:
Corral the robots by color or type, and the first to empty their hand wins!

To begin the game, each player is dealt 5 robots which they lay face-up in front of them. An additional robot is placed face-up next to the draw pile. On each player's turn, they can play a robot from their hand that matches the type or color of the top robot on the discard pile. If they cannot play, they must instead draw one robot and end their turn. A wild card can be used at any time, and the player can select which color they want it to represent.

The first player to play all of their cards wins.

Name: X-Men: Mutant Insurrection – Domino
Description: Following the announcement of X-Men: Mutant Insurrection last summer, the votes were cast to introduce a new hero to the dice-driven card game. It is that time to release the winner! The winner of the poll was the ever-popular probability manipulator, Domino. With luck on her side and a whole lot of firepower, Domino is a powerful addition to any team in X-Men: Mutant Insurrection. Domino is a free print-and-play that is available on Fantasy Flight's website.

Name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Companion
Description:
Aeronautica Imperialis – Companion is an expansion book for Aeronautica Imperialis games.

The perfect addition to any Aeronautica collection, it contains new rules, aircraft, and factions for games of Aeronautica Imperialis, as well as collating previously published content from White Dwarf magazine into one handy volume.

Inside you will find:
- Rules for fielding a Necrons force in games of Aeronautica Imperialis, including three aircraft profiles, along with upgrades and Ace Abilities
- Rules for fielding the full force of the Asuryani in games of Aeronautica Imperialis, including four all-new aircraft profiles: Vampire Raider; Vampire Hunter; Nightshade Interceptor, and Hemlock Wraithfighter.
- Rules for fielding all four Adeptus Astartes aircraft, collated in print for the first time
- A collection of aircraft profiles for existing factions not previously available in print, including the Marauder Pathfinder, Marauder Colossus, as well as rules for Looted aircraft for the Orks Air Waaagh! and Gue'Vesa Auxiliary aircraft rules for your T'au Air Caste
- New and exciting ways to play, including expanded damage rules, allowing for more detailed air combat, new Ace Abilities, Limited Ammunition rules and a dedicated set of matched play scenarios
- A suite of campaign rules allowing players to track the progress of their squadron over a series of games from rookies through to highly skilled Aces.

Please note that you will need a copy of the Aeronautica Imperialis rules in order to fully use the contents of this book.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: The Path Seekers
Description:
The Path Seekers is a sandbox tabletop experience that brings players back to an ancient China fantasy world. You are playing as one of the young protagonists who starts off with a modest background. With tremendous hard work and determination, you set off living your dream to make a difference in this treacherous time.

On players' turn, they will perform up to 3 main actions using multi-use Actions cards to move around and interact with locations on the board to improve their protagonist's attributes, and to befriend all kinds of interesting characters to help you with their special powers.

You may travel to visit different clans, learn from more than 20 new skills in the form of Action cards to execute more challenging missions, explore the uncharted cave for what lies within or hunt dangerous animals to gain precious resources and go on many more adventures. Prestige will be earned in many ways from successful missions, event interactions, gold and virtue etc.

At the end of nine months, the player with the most Prestige will be titled the winner.

Will you succeed on your quests to gain a prestigious reputation or succumb to the growing pressure and regress into obscurity? Your journey starts now as The Path Seekers.

-description from designer

Name: Bushido: The Card Game
Description:
A samurai push-your-luck, set collection game.  Take to the Dojo and Roll dice, allocating them to the available Virtues.  Learn enough Virtues of the Bushido Code to impress one of the visiting Daimyo in order to win!

Many of the Virtue cards dynamically alter the game when collected.  Focus tokens can force a player to reroll any die at any time - and each of the Daimyo have a special ability to help or hinder training!

Name: Escape Game: Die verlassene Schule
Description:
In this escape game for kids, you visit your school while it is closed. After a few seconds it gets really scary: the entrance gate suddenly closes and you can't get out!

Just like in a real Escape Room, you are locked in a mysterious place. Now you have to work together to find the exit by solving logic puzzles and mathematical problems and looking very carefully. Use the objects you find during your adventure, pay attention to even the smallest details and don't be in a hurry: if you manage to solve all the puzzles correctly, you can escape and be safe.

Name: Mystery Poster #1: A Greek Life
Description:
Mystery Poster #1: A Greek Life is the first of a series of narrative puzzle games on a poster.
 Unfold the story of your ancestor on a large (A1 format) collage.

The game consists of 13 puzzles, each composed of various fragments that the players need to connect together by using observation and deduction skills.

Name: Carcassonne Big Box 7
Description:
Carcassonne basic game including 11 expansions!
The game of the year from 2001 and 11 expansions are combined in this new Carcassonne BigBox - the perfect starter set for Carcassonne fans and anyone who wants to get to know the best-selling game in all its diversity.

Now with a new cardboard inlay. It is perfect for sorting the included expansions more easily and finding them again quickly. The tiles of the new BigBox are still unchanged and compatible with the other games and expansions.

You can combine all expansions and with over 180 tiles you can design your own combination of games as you like and experience endless fun.

The included expansions:

Inns & Cathedrals - These make cities and roads more valuable - but only if they are completed at the end of the game! Each player gains a large meeple to allow them to claim features quickly.

Traders & Builders - Traders vie for goods in the cities, while builders allow players to take multiple turns and accelerate the construction of roads and cities. Pigs on a farm can increase a farmer's yield.

The Abbot - The abbot likes to spend his day in the monastery, but he likes to pass the time in gardens in the countryside even more.

The River - The river creates varied setups at the beginning of each game, and winds through the landscape in a beautiful blue course.

The Flying Machine - Resourceful tinkerers have made their dreams of flight come true, and it's time to test their magnificent flying machines. How long the can fly, and they'll land, is still quite unpredictable.

The Messengers - The Queen sends dispatches to her loyal subjects which, if used skillfully, can be the key to attaining wealth and prestige.

The Ferries - There are many small lakes with ferries all around Carcassonne, giving travelers a great deal more variety.

The Gold Mines - We've struck gold! it's a thrilling time, and everyone wants to secure the precious metals. However, you won't know how much each gold bar is worth until the end of the game.

Mage & Witch - Magic spreads across the land! The mage causes cities and other features to flourish, while the witch can curse your opponents' favors.

The Robbers - Robbers are on the prowl, ready to steal points from your high-scoring opponents.

The Crop Circles - Mysterious circles appear in the fields, influencing the lives of knights and farmers in bizarre ways.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Aeon's End: Past and Future
Description:
Two interconnected storylines take players back in time, and hundreds of years into the future, in an exciting new expansion for Aeon's End!

Aeon's End: Past and Future includes two full expeditions: The Past Campaign and the Future Campaign. These narratives can be played in either order - Future first, or Past first.

The expansion includes:

- 10 New Mages
- 6 New Nemeses
- 18 New Market Cards
- 15 Stop Decks
- 10 Envelopes
- 2 Narrative Booklets
- 18 Card Dividers for Storage
- All Tokens Required to Play

Please Note: For expedition play, a copy of either Aeon's End: New Age or Aeon's End: Outcasts is required.

Name: Beaver Brawl
Description:
A beaver card game where players compete against each other simultaneously and try to cut down the opponent's trees!

Beaver Brawl requires players to develop alliances in the early game and play in a smart way to avoid the infamous Beaverona card(which would eliminate the player from the game).

After the Beaverona is drawn, the game becomes a pure strategy card game where attack and defend actions need to be performed at the right time not to overexpose the player.

Every player starts with 4 cards in their hands and plays a combination of them every turn to defend their tree or attack someone's tree.

They draw from the deck the same amount of cards they played.

When a player draws the Beaverona or loses all its trees, it is eliminated from the game.

The last player standing wins!

Name: Different World Merchant
Description:
The only purpose of the players is to make more money than anyone else.
With limited information, let's dispatch a person to manipulate the information and take control of the market.
Aim for the legendary Akind that will remain in posterity!

in this game players will obtain a set number of goods and know the value of 1 of the types. players then must use worker placement to trade the goods they have and effect the market value of their goods.

Name: microCrime
Description:
microCrime is a Roll-and-Write investigation game for 1+ people. You are the detective. And you need to solve the case. It features intriguing game mechanics, ever changing scenarios, a detailed Rulebook and tables. Plus, it's endless and ever changing!

The game starts soon after the Chief Inspector ends writing the premises of the case on the Case File by rolling dice several times and writing down the results took from the rulebook's tables.

At this point, all the players try to solve the case, building up a story which should include and bring to light all the elements, especially the missing ones, of the crimes scene, getting to a final solution, in order to close the case.

Detectives discuss their ideas and perceptions of the crime scene in its whole and try to figure out a possible solution, finding a meeting point that could explain the murder.

Investigation can vary in duration, based on the ability of the detectives to deal with the fundamental six questions every detective is asked to answer to close any case: How? What? When? Where? Why? Who?

While the investigation goes on, detectives should try to enrich their reconstruction of the case with more and more detailed elements.

Discussion and interpretation are fundamental, during this part of the game. Only with discussion, deduction and compromises they'll be able to meet a point where everyone is satisfied with the story.

When all involved players are pleased with the reconstruction they inform the Chief Inspector which writes down the story, closing the investigation, solving the case and, ultimately, ending the game.

It goes without saying that if players can‘t build up a story encasing all the elements of the crimes scene and get to a final solution, they can agree to archive the case. In this case players might want to try and solve the case another time, considering it a cold case.

To play this game no investigation knowledge or improvisation skills are necessary. Players debate the case, evidences and dice results by combining all the elements to create the most convincing and entertaining solution for the case.

Also, the crime scene is the main attraction of microCrime and the game gives you the opportunity to immerse yourself in it. After players select an area to play in (it might be the bedroom, the kitchen or any other space they want, like the courtyard, the garage or anything else) they can consider that space like a real crime scene by exploring it and simply by walking and looking around.

Moving through the crime scene and looking carefully at its peculiarities could prove to be really useful and interesting.

-description from designer

Name: 茶の間のきまぐれねこさま (As the Cat Says)
Description:
A family-friendly party card game with simple rules & reversal elements.

Here we are is cat café which is topic of the street. You are the staff of this shop. Cats are relaxing around. When the time goes by slowly, one of the staff whispered, "Who is most liked by them?"

You do everything to the cats. Of course, to be the most favorite of the cats in this shop.

--from the publisher

Each round, the staff of this cat café must try and guess what the cat is going to want from them. You'll know which of the four cat decks is going to be drawn from next, and if you've been paying attention, you should have an idea of the cards left in that deck. You'll play one of your four prediction cards, and either gain or lose the cat's favorability.

But be careful which prediction card you play, because you only have one of each! You can play your 'Leave Me Alone' card to avoid losing favorability, and to return all your cards back to your hand.

You also have a 'Full Power' card you can use when you're really confident in your prediction. If you guessed right, you can get a favorability bonus - either +5, +15, x3, or even x4 - depending on where you are on the scoring track. But the 'Full Power' card has to rest for a while before it can be used again, so choose wisely!

The staff member who the cats like best wins!

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Badar Promo Cards
Description:
Beta Rules - 2 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card, 1 Secret Fighting Art Card that were included with the Badar First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

2 Glossary Cards for new living glossary: Cleave and Sealed.
New Gear: Toxicimitar with Sealed bonus and gain the Crescent Step Secret Fighting Art.
New Secret Fighting Art: Crescent Step with the new Cleave action.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box, limited to 500 and includes:

Photoresin Badar
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 2 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card, 1 Secret Fighting Art Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
Deathgrey edition limited to 250: Deathgrey authenticity note

Badar drank from the chalice of black sand and embarked on his quest to slay the moon. Hatred boils within his guts, the catalyst needed to vomit black glass steps and ascend the stairless tower where his foe awaits.

Name: Last Haiku
Description:
Then the dreams overtook me. I conversed with the thousand poets long dead, they who trod the roads weaving toward eternity and never returned. In the morning’s warm embrace, my limbs felt their old vigor and the undeniable desire to travel. To seize the horizon. To behold hidden wonders. To exhume the words that will give life to my LAST HAIKU.

Last Haiku is a one-player adventure card game with a dose of creative writing. You are the latest in a long line of poets feeling your age, and you know you are not long for this world. Yet you also feel the call of distant, uncanny, and wondrous places where you might seek the inspiration to write one last haiku to leave to the ages to inspire future generations of poets, who may themselves discover stranger, more distant places to spark the words of their own haiku.

This is a “Make-as-You-Play” game, which means that the game starts with a few index cards and a pen. Each game will add new cards, either maps of locations or haiku your poet composed. The rules provide all the guidance you need for creating new cards and selecting the game’s thematic elements, which makes every copy of Last Haiku an evolving, unique world. In addition, it means that each game inherits all components added or changed in the previous games. There is no limit to the places you can visit and the poetry you can compose.

Each turn of the game involves playing cards of the appropriate distance. If the card was created in a previous game, your poet travels deeper into the frontier. If you cannot play an existing card, you create a new site on a card and your poet is inspired to write a line of haiku, these lines recorded on a separate card. The game ends when you have written each of three lines forming your poet’s last haiku, and your score equals the total of the distances of the new sites visited. Each new site and your haiku then enter the deck permanently.

-description from designer

Name: Local de Ensayo
Description:
It's your time, now you can become the author you've always wanted and set up the group you've always dreamed of for the next COAC (Cadiz's Carnival Contest). But be careful, the rest of the authors will have their mission, to annoy you and to lead a better group than yours.

This card driven game lets you get a band together to compete in Cadiz's (Spain) most prestigious contest.

This is a filler game for anyone who wants to dare to put together a group for the next COAC. You can play from 2 to 6 players and being 7 years old is enough to be able to join the game, which will last between 15 and 30 minutes.

Each turn the player plays a card from their hand of three. This could be a voice from the chorus, an instrument, or some improvement to these. Once you have four diferent voices and four instruments, you can call for the end game. At that point, players count their points and the winner is decided.

Player may, instead of playing card to add to their band, play them for their special effects, affecting other players or even calling for an early end of game and point count.

Name: The Ultimate Board Game
Description:
The Ultimate Board Game is an exciting, competitive, fun game for 2 to 8 adults. The game is inspired by Ultimate and reproduces the dynamics of a tournament between two teams, consisting of a Match, a Party and a Final Match. To become The Ultimate Champion Team, collect the most victory points from the three stages of the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Metro Domino
Description:
In Metro Domino, you use domino tiles to build metro lines across the city.

Each player starts with nine dominoes from a 9x9 set, and one random domino is placed in the central starting station. On a turn, you can draw a domino from the boneyard (i.e., the supply of dominoes) or place a domino at the end of an active line as long as you can match the number at the end of the line; the starting station can have two lines built off of the starting domino. If you place a double domino, take another turn immediately.

The starting station indicates that five dominoes must be placed in a line before a new station is opened. If you place the fifth domino in a line, draw a random station from the deck, then place it at the end of the line and mark it with one of your tokens. Each station has two lines off of it, with a starting domino half on each line and a length the line must reach before a new station is built on that line.

Players continue to take turns until either one player has emptied their hand of dominoes or the fifth station has been put into play. At the time, players score, earning 1 point for each station they started and losing 1 point for each domino still in hand.

Each city edition of Metro Domino appears to have identical gameplay, but with differing station lengths and values.

Name: Eastern Fleet: Gulf of Aden
Description:
In the spring of 1942, the Japanese contemplated invading the British-held island of Ceylon. From there they could strike many strategic targets around the Indian Ocean basin, none of these more vital than the southern outlet of the Red Sea, controlling the sea route to the Suez Canal and on to Europe. Far more important to the Axis cause than Midway Island, Japanese control of the chokepoint at the Strait of Bab-el-Mandeb would have broken British communications with India, Australia and New Zealand except for the lengthy and difficult route around the Cape of Good Hope, and made the entire campaign in North Africa superfluous.

Eastern Fleet: Gulf of Aden is a Campaign Study in the same format as Midway: Rising Sun 1940 or Coral Sea: Defending Australia, with 14 scenarios depicting a Japanese campaign in Gulf of Aden and Arabian Sea opposed by the British Eastern Fleet, heavily reinforced to defend this vital maritime crossroads. To play these scenarios, you’ll need Eastern Fleet, Horn of Africa, Midway Deluxe and Bismarck.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: 9-Card Dragonslayer
Description:
You are the great dragon slayer and have found the beast. It is cornered and now it is up to you to deliver the final blow.
Unfortunately for you the beast doesn't want to surrender and puts up a fight for its life.

Each turn you will roll your dice, assign damage to the dragon and prepare your defenses. Then the dragon will attack back, reacting with a determinable but variable sequence of actions.
The fight end when one of the opponents is slain.

—description from the designer

Name: Altai
Description:
In the land of eagle hunters and herbalists, you represent a nomadic tribe. Face the tasks of the Great Shaman. You will be accompanied by your eagle and a power animal, your moose. The journey lasts 17 rounds, during which you can choose to explore landscapes or play cards to move your equestrian figure. En route, you'll need to use your strength well, as the landscape becomes more and more spacious. When you find fountains and reach them with your figure, you can fill up your water supply and extend the range of your cards. There are also some special actions, such as "deploy water." A highlight of the game are the power places with their mighty stone pines, which rise like peaks from a sea of fog, sink and reappear at another place ... Whoever gains the highest reputation wins.

The basic game is intended for beginners, which can be expanded to an expert game, including a solo variant. Three modules await you, with additional power animals (wolf, bear and snow leopard) and much more. A campaign combine all modules to the "Golden Journey."

-description from designer

Name: Conquest of Nations
Description:
The year is 10,000 bc, take control and start your nation. Germany, Great Britain, France, the USA, and the USSR. 2-5 players lead their nations from the ancient era to victory! Explore different routes on the techtree. As you discover stronger and deadlier weapons, your enemies will coward in your power. If destruction isn't your cup of tea you can construct a rocket and leave your competitors in your dust. Trade, diplomacy, and foreign relations have never been more important as you progress and gain potential allies.

This game was created and is owned by S&J games

Name: Aeon's End: Origins
Description:
Wave 7 Expansion for Aeon's End content revealed in the Past and Future kickstarter campaign. Includes:


     1 New mage mat and deck.
     1 Pet Phoenix sideboard and deck.
     4 New market cards.
     1 New nemesis.

Name: Jok
Description:
Jok dice game:
Each player gets 1 meeple and starts at space 1 of the section of his color. The Players take turns to roll and move. On the roll of a 6 the player gets an extra roll. If a meeple gets on a prime number (framed spaces), the gets a "Jok"-token (joker). Each player may only get two tokens per game. The tokens may be used any time in the players turn to move the meeple up to 6 spaces forward. If a player already has 2 tokens or chooses not to tame one, he may move his meeple equal to the checksum of the prime number it occupies. 
Whenever a meeple gets on a number that can be divided by 11 (black spaces), it gets set back by the product of both digits. The 11 only counts as a prime number.
The first player to exactly reach space 100 wins the game.

Knight's move:
Each player gets 4 meeples which start at spaces 1, 2, 18 and 19. The meeples are moved in turns according to the knight's move in chess. All numbers that can be divided by 11 (black spaces) may not be occupied. The first player to get all his 4 meeples on space 100 wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Malzkaffee-Spiel
Description:
Each player gets 15 pawns (cups or packs). Starting positions are the first 3 rows above the red stars. The cups are placed on the pink spaces with the corn on one side and the packs on the blue spaces with the cups on the other side of the board.
The goal of the game is to get 6 pieces on the red stars on the opposite side of the game board.

Movement is 1 space per turn diagonally forward. Orthogonal movement is only allowed to reach a red star. Opponent pieces are taken by jumping over them to an empty space behind them. Pieces on a space with a letter are safe and may not be jumped over.

—user summary

Name: Secret Cardinals
Description:
Secret Cardinals is a ‘take that’ player elimination game of Vice, Virtues, and hidden Roles within Roles. Eliminate political opponents and survive the power struggle from within the 15th century church through deception, sabotage, and calculated choices. For each turn, clever players will need to strategize their actions wisely to deduce who their political rivals are, acquire gold for its power, or gamble their advantage on the role of the dice. Use gold to purchase indulgences, gain virtues by giving charity, or pay a bribe to find rivals guilty of vice. Each turn brings unexpected dangers and new ways to win.

Rome, 1418. The Papal standoff that had split the church for decades has just concluded, but tensions still linger from when three rival popes simultaneously claimed to be the one true pope. Each claimant was backed by a competing power of Europe: Rome, Pisan, and Avignon. Driven by politics rather than theological disagreement, the church was thrown into turmoil. To find a compromise, a fourth Pope was chosen to succeed as the legitimate head of the church. As a result, the other three claimants were deposed, jailed for heresy, or excommunicated for their disobedience. In order to maintain a delicate network of alliances among the ruling powers, the new Pope has secretly named his choice for a new Cardinal from among these powers to honor this player’s service while keeping them safe from the political machinations of the competing Kingdoms.

Adversaries with hidden agendas and hidden roles are looking to eliminate their opponents and win the game. An upstart with an agenda wants to be acknowledged as the Secret Cardinal and is looking to eliminate the competition. A rival Roman Cardinal is not keen to recognize the influence of the new Pope and the fanaticism of their Devoted Follower creates a dangerous situation for anyone trying to upset the status quo. No one is safe from the Heretic infiltrators, as they work to limit the growing influence of the church, even as the are being hunted by the an overzealous Inquisitor who is determined to root out anyone suspected of heresy. Lastly, interlopers associated with the neighboring monarchy have not forgotten their candidate for Pope was excommunicated and have sent a Royal Spy from Avignon to cause trouble.

Players will see similarities to Bang and One Night Ultimate Werewolf, with unexpected action cards and new ways to win with roles within roles.

—description from the designer

Name: Battle Array
Description:
"Battle Array" is a set of 'fast play' wargame rules intended to simulate major battles from the ancient period until about 1500. It is played with miniatures or counters on a table top or board consisting of squares to regulate movement and distances and to speed up play by avoiding interaction and measurement issues. The system places less emphasis on weapons and more on training, quality and morale. Several historical battle scenarios are provided but, as usual in table top gaming players can also select their own armies and play 'random' battles such as Sumerian v 100 Years War French. The game is intended for experienced players and assumes that they know how to collect, paint and base figures and provide their own playing equipment such as dice, terrain and so on.

—description from the designer

Name: Witchbound
Description:
The once-famous island of Coven Cove hasn’t seen a real witch in over 100 years, until now. Be it a mistake, or fate, you have awakened your magic and are now bound to the island. While the cozy town is full of fascinating characters willing to help, none can undo this. You must venture out into the wilds to explore the ruins of what the witches left behind. Perhaps you’ll find answers, or maybe, you’ll discover being a witch isn’t so bad. You will find, however, danger around every corner, as the island keeps a dark secret.

Gameplay Overview

A grand adventure awaits you in this open-world style story-driven game. You’ll explore scenes full of details for you to interact with using the skills, items, and prompts you acquire. These interactions lead to entries in the massive storybook full of branching narratives, puzzles, and illustrated cut-scenes. As each day ends you’ll recover from your adventures but just as the moon changes, so does the world around you. As events unfold you will learn more about your journey.
Each and every decision you make matters.

—description from the designer

Name: Shining Shadows Saga
Description:
Shining Shadows Saga is a strategy-based trading card game inspired by Japanese Role-Playing Games (JRPG). Using a customized deck of skills, spells, will, and other actionable cards, players battle in an arena-like fashion to knock out each others champions and become victorious.

Based on the recommendations of the Seer of Sanctuary, Azara, Monarchs can choose up to 3 ancient champions to take into battle. These champions from the past all hail from different realms within the world of Limsia where they once were revered by their respective species. Players take turns controlling their champions and use actionable cards that can cool down to be used again and the first player to deplete the HP of all of their opponents' champions is the winner.

As this is a strategy-heavy game, players can best strategize gameplay by using weapons and potions from their inventory to influence survivability and any attacks that are relevant to their champions of choice. New cards are released monthly so players can build as many unique and versatile decks as possible to vary their gameplay and avoid being locked in to specific play styles. With the number of champions growing, every battle provides a new ground for players of all skill levels to show off their customizations and strategies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Revengineers!: The Reverse Engineering Party Dice Game
Description:
Revengineers! is a 3 to 10-player party game.

You and your fellow Revengineers are in a race to reverse engineer computer “viruses”, so that the Cybercrime Division can trace them to their source and catch the hackers in their hideouts.

Each player takes it in turn to become a “virus”, and draws 1 to 3 Program Cards. The other players use dice rolls as inputs for that virus program. The Virus Player looks at the dice rolled, and speaks the output, as described by their Program Cards. This continues until one of the Revengineers successfully determines what the Program Cards say.

With increasing levels of difficulty, this game is exciting for adults and kids alike. If you can read, and do basic arithmetic, you can play this game.

—description from the designer

Name: Scattered Nexus: Comic Calamity
Description: The second installment of the Scattered Nexus card game, a battle-style card game based on indie comics. Using shuffle building you make a team of three comic factions to defeat your opponent. This set expands player options by featuring 6 new comics: Aurora, Edge, Next Reaper, Little Warrior, and Plume.

Name: Ich will nicht
Description:
Each player chooses his goal. Either he tries to get rid of all his cards or to collect two sets of cards from 1 to 6.

At the beginning each player is dealt 8 number cards and 2 "Ich will nicht (I don't want to)"-cards. The remaining "Ich will nicht"-cards are laid out in the middle of the table. The "ich will nicht"-cards are used as dummies when cards are exchanged to fool the 3rd player.

Each player has the following options to play his turn:


     The player rolls three dice. The result determines which  cards he may give to his left neighbor. He may choose as many cards as he wants as long as their combined value does not exceed the result of his roll.
     The player declares "Ich will nicht" and does nothing.
     The player takes 1 or 2 "Ich will nicht" cards from the Table
     The players places 1 or 2 "Ich will nicht" cards from his hand on the table.
     The player calls a number (1-6) or "Ich will nicht" cards. His left neighbor must show his hand. If he has more than 2 of these cards, he has to give one or both of the surplus cards to the active player and has to pay 5 coins for hoarding cards. In the other case the active player has to pay 2 coins for falsely accusing the other player.


—user summary

Name: Human Punishment: Social Deduction 2.0 – The Beginning Promo Cards
Description:
7 additional ID cards added as a bonus to Human Punishment: The Beginning. They represent the characters from the prequel and have unique abilities.

Human: Dryden, Jayden
Machine: Feykah, Havoc
Outlaw: Nova, Dee Coy, Kuro

Name: UNO: Pokemon Asia
Description:
"Join Pikachu and all his friends when you play this Pokemon edition of UNO! Master the game with the special 'Snorlax Traffic' and 'Battle Bond' rules! And when you're down to your last card, don't yell 'pika pika', yell UNO!"

UNO variation where all of the cards have a pokemon, including some of the original 150 and newer pokemon from Sword & Shield.

The deck is the same as normal UNO, but with 4 extra wild cards:

- Wild Snorlax Traffic Cards: you choose a colour, the next player draws 3 cards and then discard all cards of your chosen colour from their hand (their turn ends).
- Wild Battle Bond Card: you choose a colour and the next player draws a card. If their drawn card does not match the chosen colour, they have to draw another card. You can then choose the colour that continues play.

You can choose to play a normal game of UNO without these extra cards, or keep them in for something a bit different.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Arixia: War of Essence
Description:
In Arixia: War of Essence, players take on the role of a god/goddess. Select one of five thematic and asymmetric factions consisting of multiple tiered units including: common, elite, specialist, general, and a mighty avatar unit class. Throughout the game, players will destroy each others’ units and accumulate their “essence” as well as fight over control points, known as Essence Wells. Harnessed essence is used to activate unique, faction-specific abilities. 
With enough essence, your god will be able to manifest in the physical realm in the form of a massive avatar. Empowered avatars gain access to once-per-game Act of God abilities to swing the tide of battle in your favor. If you destroy the enemy’s avatar, you are victorious!

Gameplay is turn-based and consists of several phases. First, each player rolls an Essence Storm die to determine which way the Essence Storm will blow and which variable effect it will take on during that game round. Next, player one will take their turn. During a player turn consists of two phases, the movement phase and the activation phase. The movement phase allows your entire army to move up to their maximum speed stat. The activation phase allows up to two units to attack and use the active special abilities of those units. Thus, interesting situations arise where some units get into position for future turns, contest Essence Wells from opponents, or keep your options open on the fly.

However, because only two of your units can attack each turn, you must carefully plan not only your current turn, but think about how future turns might play out. Players roll unique-faced dice to simplify gameplay and avoid having to memorize combat tables. Additionally, most powerful units have access to faction-specific Divine Dice, providing a boost to damage, defense or annoying tricks. Additionally, players have the option to complete their turn phases in either order they wish, opening up further tactical options as needed! After players have taken their turns, a new game round begins, repeating this process until one side defeats the enemy avatar!

-description from designer

Name: The Librarians: Quest for the Spear
Description:
Where the core set is focused on the first season of the TV show, this expansion is focused on the first movie. It contains 3 new adventures that collectively tell the story of the movie. You get to explore the Amazon jungle, hike the Himalaya mountains, and break into the Metropolitan Museum. Each adventure includes fun new mechanical twists on the rules found in the core set. These adventures end up being very fun to play and extremely thematic, but they are also a bit more complicated than those found in the core box.

The expansion also includes 2 playable heroes complete with suggested starting decks. These include Nicole Noone and Flynn Carsen, the character who started the franchise.

Name: The Librarians: Jenkins Character Pack
Description:
Jenkins is now a playable hero! Complete with a suggested starting deck of all new cards ready to play out of the box. For those looking forward to building your own decks, the expansion has 3 new generic disciplines (groups of 7 cards) that can be included in any hero's deck, so it really opens up the deck building possibilities for all your heroes!

Jenkins is a kickstarter exclusive expansion and will not be available at retail.

Name: Duo Purple (fan expansion for Mega Man Pixel Tactics)
Description:
The Duo Purple Box is a fan expansion collection of every Robot Master from the Mega Man Classic series that did not get a color 8-bit release. The expansion features 8-bit sprites from various fan games, and abilities created by users on Board Game Geek.

The 40 cards can combine with the Kickstarter Rewards pack and the Stardroids Pack to create a 4th and 5th full-sized deck.

The Robot Masters are from the following games:

    Mega Man 7 (SNES)
    Mega Man 8 (Playstation 1)
    Mega Man and Bass (SNES)
    Mega Man and Bass 2 (Wonderswan)
    Mega Man the Wily Wars (Genesis)
    Mega Man Powered Up (PSP)
    And a few other surprises

Name: Pavé
Description:
Pavé is an original kiwi strategy game.

A two player path building game played across a grid that is deceptively simple, emergently complex, and ruthlessly competitive, Pavé is a timeless game for all ages.

Pavé is a very simple game to play and understand. It has fewer rules than you expect.

To start the game each player grabs 5 Pavé tokens from the bag
Your goal is to use the paths on the tokens to connect your 2 board edges while your opponent is trying to connect the other 2 edges.

You alternate playing tokens, and top up after each turn.
Tokens may also be stacked to redirect the path.

The first player with a completed path to call "Pave" wins the round.

The core game concepts are:

Randomization
    Hidden Information
    Connections
    A Dynamic Board State

Pavé tests the player’s skills of

Pattern Recognition
    Spatial awareness
    Strategy and Planning
    Calculating Probability
    Bluffing and reading bluffs

Name: Princesas Dragon
Description:
A board game based on the children's books by Pedro Mañas.

Princesas Dragon  is a interaction card game where you need to collect 3 different princesses to get one dragon. The first player in get four dragon will be the winner.

You play with three cards in your hand and you must take decision about three different action (use action card, put princess in the table, discard one card and draw a new card).

—user summary

Name: The Quest for El Dorado: Dangers & Muisca
Description: New adventures in The Quest for El Dorado! This expansion introduces the new modules “Dangers” and “Muisca”. The Muisca is a mysterious tribe that wants to help you find the city of gold. “Dangers” brings new challenges such as crocodiles, rapids and temples with keys to the City of Gold. Combine with new cave tokens for even more variety!
Families: Game: The Quest for El Dorado

Name: Olymplakks
Description:
Olymplakks is a revolutionary board game that brings together more than 12 sports in an epic competition. From traditional sports such as basketball, hockey, bowling, and football to more unique events such as climbing, petanque and high jumping, this game has it all.

Players must use strategy and skill to successfully complete each challenge. The game is played as follows:

• START: Strategically hit your disc and watch out for your opponents because they can hit your disc and change your position. 
• PICK THE CARD: Depending on where the disc has landed, you must pick one of the following cards: Group Card, Individual Card, Draw Card, Positive Card, and Negative Card.
• MINI-GAMES: Perform the mini-games and depending on the cards and results obtained in each event, points are either added to or subtracted from the scoreboard.
• ACCUMULATE POINTS: Once the players have all played the cards that have been dealt to them, the disc is thrown again, one at a time. Accumulate points by passing the mini-games to win the game.

The first one to reach 100 points wins.

Overall, Olymplakks is the ultimate multi-sport board game, perfect for all ages and with high quality components that capture the spirit of each sport. Whether you are a sports enthusiast or just looking for a fun and challenging game to play with friends and family, it is sure to provide hours of entertainment and excitement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Juduku 4: Révélations Explosives
Description:
Juduku Explosive Revelations contains 480 new cards to reveal your friends' and family's worst thoughts, as well as Sudden Death and Mime cards to spice up your evenings even more: that means more spicy answers and more hilarious situations.

This new opus of Juduku comprises 4 decks to renew the pleasure:

    the quiet "Pépouze"
    the terrible "Confessions"
    the famous "Girl's Night"
    the spicy "X Rated"


The rules remain similar, the players have to answer in only 8 seconds to questions like:

    Name 3 dishes that you often cook but that Philippe Etchebest would spit in your face!
    Name 3 ways to get a drink!
    Name 3 things you prepare before a date!


—Description from the publisher.

Name: Merchants Cove: Master Craft
Description:
Welcome back ashore! Merchants Cove: Master Craft is a big-box expansion for the critically acclaimed Merchants Cove.

Contained in this treasure trove of content is a new expansion (The Faction Festival), new modular content (new Rogues, Townsfolk), as well as four new expert Merchants.

In addition to the new Merchants, the Faction Festival also expands the game in a substantial way. A new board is connected to the bottom of the main board adding tracks for each of the Factions, and brand new mechanisms for each Faction to use. The Wizards will enchant your goods to make them worth more - while the Rogues will help you frame the other players, letting you get rid of corruption by pinning it on your opponents.

That’s not all! Enjoy a new Faction Hall (The Paladins), new Adventurers (Paladins), new Townsfolk, Rogues, and more.

-description from publisher

Name: I Tre Porcellini
Description:
The Three Little Pigs is a fantastic building game.
Build the houses of the three little pigs like in the fairy tale! Roll the dice to collect all the pieces of the wooden house, the brick house and the straw house. Thanks to the interlocking puzzle, learn to recognize colors and shapes and ... Always be careful of the wolf!

Each player has to build a set of houses consisting of a thatched house, one of wood and one of bricks.

It is played in turns, clockwise. If you are the smallest, you will be the first to play! The goal is to build first all the houses.

On your turn, after sorting the house tiles, roll the die and see what happens!

Name: La Casa Stregata
Description:
Strange noises come from the house!

Legend has it that on the longest night of the year, in the haunted Whippole Manor, the terrible Ghost Buu and his henchmen wake up and go around the city to scare the inhabitants. Only a brave hero can stop them, finding the only thing inside the house that calms Buu and makes him return to his age-old rest ...

… His ghost teddy bear!

The haunted house is a very simple game, inside the box you will find some tiles that will be used to represent the rooms and corridors of the house.

After placing the tiles to represent a haunted house, place all the characters on the starting tile the last one who was in a haunted house starts playing! Roll the die, make your move and flip the arrival tile, performing the action shown on it.
The objective of the game is to find the tile containing the ghost bear and bring it back to him to win the game.

Name: Halves
Description:
HALVES is a word game for the ruthless!

At home, the office, band practice, in the bar or on a plane (where this game was conceived!) bring your friends together and find out who is the wordiest of all.  
Be careful though, winning cards is the easy bit, staying in the lead is where things get complicated.

To win the game, simply Guess the word on your opponent’s card to win points. Be the player with the most points at the end of the game!

The active player must choose a word from one card in their hand for their opponents to try and guess. The colour behind the chosen word dictates the game type for the round:
- Yellow is CATEGORIES, 
- Blue is RHYMES WITH,
- Red is PERFECT PAIRS.

The active player must think of a clue for their word. Then they announce the game type and their clue to all players who have 30 seconds to guess it.
Any cards a player has won from a previous round is at risk from TRAP cards.

Guess, Swap, Bluff or Steal your way to put points on the table and be the envy of all your friends and family!

Created by Carter & Richardson the same minds that make up your favourite punk rock and roll band The Rattlesnakes.

Name: Forest Sky: Open Air
Description:
Whether it's the intimidating vulture or the imitative mockingbird, most birds still pair off when it's time to build a nest.

A 6-card expansion for Forest Sky, featuring 3 2-card sets that can be added individually or in any combination: Mockingbirds, Vultures, and Nests.


A delightful expansion that can be added in its entirety, or just mixing in some of the pairs and not others with the base game to change up the experience. Vultures are nice, since they score either cards from the discard or from the forest which helps pivot when that card you really wanted for your hand ends up locked down elsewhere. Mockingbirds provide wild abilities to let them count as another bird type or value. And Nests score bonus points if you have exactly two birds of the same type in your chosen forest. These are fun, solid additions to the game and exactly what you want to see from an expansion.

Name: B17 Twenty Five Missions
Description:
Awards:
-1 Place best innovative mechanic in: 12th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place best Solitaire game in: 12th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place best game in: 12th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place best foreign language game in: 12th roll and write design contest.

B17 Twenty five Missions is a game in which we will live the experience inside a B17, and in which we will bomb various targets to overcome the goal of 25 missions to return home.

This is a Roll And Write mechanics game for one player with a minimum duration of 20 minutes.

To play it is recommended to have:

     The bomber sheet, the objectives sheet and if you are playing in campaign mode the mission report sheet (It is recommended that the sheets be with a polypropylene protector)
     An erasable marker.
     -Various D6 Dice


Objective:

Complete 1 match without the bomber being shot down.
Complete all 25 missions (campaign) with a single bomber.

Name: Wehrmacht bricht durch
Description:
Each player gets 20 playing pieces (cardboard tokens) to represent different army units: 
1 commander, 1 occupying force, 1 bulwark, 2 cavalry, 3 warplanes, 3 artillery, 3 tanks and 6 infantry.
The game board is a square grid with buildings and lakes as obstacles. Only the planes may move over the obstacles. each kind of unit has it's own way to move or to capture enemy units.
A unit is captured if an enemy unit gets on the same space.

The goal of the game is to capture the enemy commander or occupy the two corner spaces (marked with a star) in enemy territory.

The game was published during WW II.

Name: Curse of the Wymer Stones
Description:
A retro dungeon crawling board game for 2-5 players. Play as one of four heroes or even as the villain!â€‹

As one of the heroes, you will make your way through the catacombs, working together to fend off dangerous creatures and traps as you search for your Wymer Stone. You must use your stone to defeat the Cursed Dwarves and save the kingdoms of Overwyrld from the evil Wymer.

As the villain, you set traps and locks for the heroes to battle. Also, you will control the Cursed Dwarves as you attempt to defeat the heroes and doom Overwyrld to destruction by the Wymer.

DIFFERENT OUTCOMES
Encounters have two outcomes. If the hero wins, the thumbs up side of the card is read. If the hero loses, the thumbs down portion is read. Even the game itself has outcomes based on if the heroes are victorious or not.

SIMPLE SCORING
Encounters are decided by one die for the hero and one die for the villain. They roll against each other, and any bonuses are added to the roll to see who wins the encounter. The math never gets bigger than adding up to twelve, which is good, because math is terrible.

THE BOARD GAME WE ALWAYS WANTED TO PLAY
When we designed this game, we made it for players like us. We wanted it to be easy to learn, simple to play and challenging enough that we would want to play again.

With a lot of effort and fine-tuning, we arrived at a game that we would have loved if it had existed when we were 14. Does that mean you'll love it? We hope so. If you're looking for a complicated, intricate and punishing game, this probably isn't the game you're looking for. If you want a retro roll to resolve adventure with a compelling story that is simple to learn and play, this is the game for you!

—description from the designer

Name: Palmela
Description:
The image of the friar-knight has in its way shaped the history of the Palmela castle throughout the centuries. The monks who inhabited said castle lived periods in which a call-to-arms would make knights out of them. In this game, this duality is present in the split value of cards and the twofold way they can be played: either facing up or down.

Each round, players will play character cards. Simultaneously, they will try to guess the sum of the score of all currently played character cards. The goal is to find out whether the friar’s value or the knight’s value is equal or greater than the history value of the castle card being contested in the current round.

The game is over when the 12 rounds are finished and the players count the points in the Castles cards. The winner is the player with the most victory points.

-description from publisher

Name: Targi: Die Bonus-Box
Description: To coincide with the tenth anniversary of Targi, designer Andreas Steiger and publisher KOSMOS are releasing Targi: Die Bonus-Box, which contains wooden tokens to replace the goods tiles in the base game, two modules of six new edge cards, new action cards, and rules for a solo mode. The material in this expansion can also be combined with Targi: The Expansion.

Name: Game of Treasure Island
Description:
A spin-and-move game based on Robert Louis Stevenson's classic novel, you must take Jim Hawkins through his travels from the Admiral Benbow Inn at the top left of the board to Bristol England in the top right. The spaces are arranged in columns which you move up and down.

This game was originally released in 1923 by Stoll & Edwards. It was reprinted twice: as part of their "Two-Games-in-One" line in the late 1920s, and revised (with new multicolor board art) as Stoll & Einson's "Treasure Island" in 1934.

Name: Pub Battles: Bull Run – The Great Skedaddle
Description:
Bull Run is a tense Military Strategy Board Game where players lead new, green armies in this first major battle of the American Civil War.

Union general McDowell developed a brilliant plan to launch a surprise flanking attack. Confederate general Beauregard was able to reinforce with Johnston’s army from the valley by rail. Many expected this to be the only battle needed to put down the rebellion. Instead, panic gripped both armies of green troops as they closed for combat. This quickly escalated into a full on rout all the way back to Washington, becoming known as “The Great Skedaddle”.

• Huge map (38” x 24”) covers the extended area, so you can explore many different possible strategies to the battle. 
• This map also covers the area fought over in Second Bull Run, to allow for a Add-On, expansion scenario. 
• Hardwood, Kriegsspiel style blocks for Fog-of-War.
• Fast play time. 
• Tremendous Replayability. 
• Excellent for Solitaire play.

Instead of giving players complete control of their units and perfect intell, this system focuses on realistic command and logistical limitations.  In this chaotic and uncertain environment, you must learn to adapt your plans to accomplish your objectives.

This highly acclaimed rules system is based on real combat data, officer experience and training principles from the era:  Kriegsspiel.  It is used to train officers in the US military and in military academies around the world.

Yvonne Sparrowsmith is the developer.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Lost in the South Seas
Description: A spin-and-move game based on Daniel Defoe's classic novel "Robinson Crusoe," this was originally released in 1924 by Stoll & Edwards. It was reprinted twice: as part of their "Two-Games-in-One" line in the late 1920s, and revised (with new multicolor board art) as Stoll & Einson's "Marooned in the South Seas" in 1934, part of their "Playjoy" line.

Name: Walt Disney's Cinderella Game
Description:
This is a simple racing game for children based on Walt Disney's 1950 animated film "Cinderella." The multicolor gameboard includes a folding card backdrop with the game's title and movie characters, which creates an effect similar to a stage.

Each player choose a pair of colored metal slipper tokens. Then, one of each pair is dropped into a bag and placed at the race's end (the castle). Progress is determined by drawing character cards that tell how many spaces to move, with each player moving using their remaining slipper. The player who gets to the castle first chooses a slipper randomly from the bag and if it matches theirs, they win the game and become Cinderella. If not, they go back and start the race again from the middle of the game track.

—user summary

Name: FOUNDERS
Description:
In the midst of a windswept, snowy landscape, a group of explorers discover a gigantic cave with a massive structure that radiates out from it. Around this Hearth, the Master Founders lay the foundation for what will become The City, home to the powerful Guilds of I C E!
Following the directives of the first Founders' Council on the Design of the City, as well as the Requests of the first Guilds, you will design and create this famous City from scratch!

F O U N D E R S is a strategic and innovative game of tile placement where each player is in a hidden alliance with 2 other players they don't know.
The games last around 30 min for 2 to 5 players from 10 years old.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Emperor's New Clothes
Description:
The Emperor's New Clothes is a flip & write game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Players draw patterns to puzzle together a pretty shirt abiding by the rules set by the Emperor. Each round 3 patterns will be revealed, and one of the players may reserve a pattern. All players then draw their chosen pattern adjacent to something they have already drawn. Some patterns needs to be grouped together orthogonally, others diagonally and some of them not together at all. You score points after 6 rounds and again after 12 rounds - so players are forced to think short term and long term, and most points wins. There is also a bonus for completed rows and diversity.

The game has several difficulty levels and spans from family game to thinky gamer filler.

About the fairy tale:
The Emperor's New Clothes portrays a vain emperor that only wants the finest clothes. Two guys swindle him into believing they can weave an exceptionally beautiful attire that only the smartest can see. In reality there are no clothes but reluctant to admit he isn't smart, he parades through town until a boy yells out: "but he isn't wearing any clothes!"
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: The Emperor's New Clothes

Name: The Little Mermaid
Description:
The Little Mermaid is a flip & write game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Flip cards and cross out 1-3 adjacent animals in the underwater world but watch out because incomplete polyominos will score you negative points at the end. Complete rows and you will get a bonus power.

About the fairy tale:
The Little Mermaid lives together with her five sisters. The youngest and most curious amongst her siblings, she explores the underwater world. Yet life beneath the sea isn't enough for her. When she falls in love with a shipwrecked prince, she makes a deal with the evil witch. She trades her voice for legs, in an attempt to win the prince's everlasting love.

—description from the publisher
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: The Little Mermaid

Name: The Ugly Duckling
Description:
The Ugly Duckling is a flip & write game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Draw polyomino shapes around the animals on the farm and in the country side. You want to fill the board but also to draw around specific animals - each round a new animal will score you extra points.

About the fairy tale:
The Ugly Duckling hatches at a duck family that wants nothing to do with him, because he is different. Chased out into the world, he thus begins a long journey that lasts all winter, throughout which he tries to find out where he belongs. The duckling experiences lots of grievances before finally seeing his own reflection and discovering he is a beautiful swan.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Snow Queen
Description:
The Snow Queen is a card game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Push your luck to win the best friendship cards but be careful not to reach 10 in a colour that will cause you to bust. The question is simple: Take a card or stop? The set of friendship cards on offer changes every round so the challenge is knowing when to take the card and when to stop.

About the fairy tale:
The Snow Queen has frozen Kay's heart. His best friend Gerda embarks on a long journey to save their friendship while there is still time. She travels across mountains, snow covered forests and frozen lakes towards the cold north, before finally lifting the Snow Queen's curse and proving that friendship conquers all.

Name: The Princess and the Pea
Description:
The Princess and the Pea is a card game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Be the first to play all your cards on the ever growing pile of mattresses and pillows. Either play 1 card that is higher and changes colour or 1 or more cards that are lower and matches colour. First to empty their hand of cards is the winner.

About the fairy tale:
On a dark night it knocks on the door, and out in the rain a princess seeks shelter. Yet is she a true princess? The queen tests her and does so by providing a bed with a huge tower of mattresses, and a tiny pea placed at the bottom. In the morning the princess wakes from a terrible night's sleep, proving she is a true princess.

-description from publisher

Name: The Tinderbox
Description:
The Tinderbox is a card game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Play cards simultaneously and reveal them to see what treasures you got this round. You want the most valuable but too much of a good thing might leave you with a bitter taste and zero points.

About the fairy tale:
Heading home the soldier meets a witch that offers him gold and silver coins, if he climbs into a hollow tree and gets a Tinderbox for her. The soldier is greedy and also claims the Tinderbox. Later he discovers its power to call upon the dogs with huge eyes. With his new found power the soldier attempts to win the princess and the entire kingdom.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stratego WWE
Description:
Stratego WWE RAW SMACKDOWN, is a Diset tabletop game with a mix of wrestling and strategy from the year 2008.

Keep your Champion status and on the attack! Stratego WWE is a game full of adventures and surprises. You are the Trainer of Superstars and Divas of different value and your mission is to maintain your status as Champion and capture the title of your opponent. Place your Superstars and Divas in secret, your opponent must not know the tactic you are going to use!

Name: Streets: Board Game Arena Promo Tile
Description:
Adds an Arcade to the Streets!
Replaces a wild tile mid-game. 
After stage 2 of set up, remove one random "wild" tile from the stack, then shuffle this tile into the deck.

Name: You Laugh You Drink
Description:
150 cards with hilarious prompts that will make you laugh! On your turn, do what the card says and don't hold back. Can you keep a straight face? Keep a straight face or bottoms up!

HOW TO PLAY


     The funniest person draws a card first. They are now the Joker. The Joker silently reads the card to themselves.
     The Joker then tells the group who they are going to target. The Target is the person they are trying to get to laugh.
     The Joker now has 30 seconds to do whatever is on the card, doing their best to make the Target laugh. Everyone else (including the Joker) is allowed to laugh.
     If the Target laughs, they drink and the Joker keeps the card and gets a point. If the Target doesn’t laugh, the Joker drinks and the Target keeps the card and gets a point.
     The person to the Joker’s left now becomes the new Joker. The new Joker draws a new card and picks a new Target. The same person can’t be targeted twice in a row!
     First to 7 points wins.


Note: The Joker can always pass on their turn if they don’t want to do what’s on the card. They should take a sip of shame if they choose to pass.

—description from publisher

Name: Superheroes of Centerville
Description:
Superheroes of Centerville is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players who work together as superheroes to defeat a swarm of villains attacking the Centerville City Hall.  The villains rush towards the center of the board while the superheroes use their powers to hold them back and defeat them.  There are 16 superheroes and 4 villain groups to choose from.  Each superhero has a unique set of powers, and each villain group has a unique mix of abilities.

Each player gets a hand of energy cards which they use to activate their hero's powers.  They must use the cards efficiently to have enough power to stop the villains.  There are also stunt cards which can be used to change how a power works.

Each superhero has a different set of powers.  Some superheroes are similar to each other and others are very different.  Playing each requires figuring out their strengths and weaknesses and devising tactics that work for them.

The villain groups are giant insects, zombies, ninjas, and robots.  Each has a different balance of movement and strength, requiring different tactics to defeat them.

—description from the designer

Name: Chrononauts: Missing Artifacts
Description:
A time traveler's work is never done.

With Chrononauts: Missing Artifacts, you can add six new mission cards to either Chrononauts or Early American Chrononauts — or both! These new missions will send you through time in search of missing treasures like one of the lost Fabergé Eggs, D.B. Cooper's suitcase full of money, a gemstone from Mars, and even the Holy Grail itself. (But make sure you choose the right one!) Or you might need to find a fully functional Antikythera Mechanism, a papyrus containing the secret to how the Great Pyramid was built, or a golden statue of Throk-Trak (hero of the cockroach revolution which happens 83 million years after WW3).

The 18-card Chrononauts: Missing Artifacts expansion also includes a couple of powerful new gadgets: the Reality Shifter and the Temporal Stabilizer.

—description from the publisher


Card List

Actions (1):

     Sell an Artifact (Riches Bonus)


Artifacts (9):

     Cooper's Cash
     Fully Functional Antikythera Mechanism 
     Great Pyramid Construction Papyrus
     Live Silphium Plant
     Lost Fabergé Egg
     Mars Gemstone
     The Holy Grail
     The Schmoly Grail
     Throk-Trak Statuette


Gadget (2):

     Paradox Stabilizer
     Reality Shifter


Missions (6):

     Back the the Bible
     Cash and Prizes
     Exotic Flora and Fauna
     Founders' Day
     Lost Technologies
     Pyramid Schemes

Name: Battle 4 Mars
Description: Humans have invaded Mars, but Martians aren't going down without a fight! Each player chooses a deck and issues orders to their troops to break through the other player's defenses and win the game.

Name: Sherlock: Case Connection – Promo Cards
Description:
A set of two promo cards giving away at conventions with purchase of the game.

Both are Thread cards; one with Forensic Proof and Cyber Proof icons and the other with Forensic Proof and Witness Proof icons.

Name: Community Garden
Description:
It’s time to make our Community Garden thrive! Players will use Gardeners to gather resources like water and compost and then will play cards ranging from dill to strawberries to butternut squash. The player who has scored the most points through growing their garden and collecting Harvest cards wins the game. But this is a community garden, so you’ll be helping your fellow players acquire the resources they need to make their plots prosper as well.

Community Garden is played over 7 rounds, in which players are aiming to collect resources - water, compost, trowels, and seedlings - in order to play Garden cards, such as oregano, collard greens, and shishito pepper. On their turn, players will place one Gardener on the board to gain resources, gain Garden cards, or to use Tool cards.

Players will also be collecting Green Thumbs, which are then spent in order to join other players in busy garden spaces. Green Thumbs also have another benefit: they often allow you to activate Tool cards. Each Tool card has a unique effect, and when you place a Gardener on a tool, you use the effect listed on the card. This might help you gain a number of resources at once, take an extra turn, or create other combinations of effects.

Players also use their Gardeners to draw cards from the Garden beds, strategically adding new Garden Cards to their hand that will give them points and helpful bonuses.

On each player's turn, after they've placed a gardener, they'll be able to spend resources they've collected to plant (play) Garden cards from their hand. They'll then place the Garden card they've just played in collections in front of them into plots of the same color. And any time a player completes a pair of the same color of Garden cards (such as two brown Garden cards) or a row of all the colors (brown, pink, silver, and red), they will draw bonus Harvest cards. Each Harvest card is randomly worth anywhere from 1 to 3 points.

After 7 rounds, the player who has scored the most points through planting Garden cards and collecting Harvest cards, wins the game!

-description from designer

Name: Forbidden Psalm: In the Footsteps of the Mad Wizard
Description:
A campaign setting for the core book, Forbidden Psalm, a 28mm miniatures agnostic game where you can use suitable miniatures you already own or build custom minis for solo and Coop play.
In the Footsteps of the Mad Wizard picks up the narrative where the core book leaves off. In this campaign expansion your warband of 5 greedy souls will face new trials, find new treasures, recruit pets and die in horrible ways.

This book adds new weapon tables, new spells, new equipment, new feats, flaws and a 15 session long campaign that can be used for both the MÖRK BORG ttrpg and Forbidden Psalm miniatures game.

Including:


     A new Campaign system, featuring richer opportunities for progression and injury
     15 new scenarios
     Pets! Pets! Pets!
     More weapons, relics, and treasures
     10+ New monsters
     Randomness Intensifies: dozens of new tables for that sweet sweet emergent narrative


—description from the publisher

Name: Slaughterville III
Description:
An expansion featuring a collection of new Villains for Slaughterville!

Includes: The Beeman, The Sleeper, and The Vermes.

Slaughterville Director's Cut or Slaughterville 2 is required to play this game.

Name: Goblin Firework Fight: Fumbus Promo Card
Description:
Originally released as a promotional card for Pathfinder Goblin Firework Fight, Fumbus is an additional Advanced Goblin to help discourage others stealing from you!

This card was included in Game Trade Magazine # 268 (June 2022) or can be purchased directly from Paizo.

Name: Сказание (Skazanie)
Description:
Ð¡ÐºÐ°Ð·Ð°Ð½Ð¸Ðµ ("Skazanie") is a fast and dynamic game for 2-4 players. It is easy to learn and explain. This game will take its players on a journey through the ancient Slavic lands and ages long-past, and show them a world of powerful gods, mythical creatures and omens.
The game is played by drawing battle cards and magical cards. Each round consists of rolling a die to determine the player's strength and then playing a battle card, which adds even more strength to the die. Magical cards are utilised to further enhance a player's strength, or to affect negatively the opponent/opponents. The winner of the round is the player with the highest strength after each player has chosen their battle card and magical cards. The game ends when there are no cards left in the drawing piles. The player with the highest score (most rounds won) is considered the winner.

Name: The Witcher: Old World – Exclusive Monster Pack
Description:
The Exclusive Monster Pack includes 3 new Monster Miniatures, each with a special Monster Card, designed to fit the Expansion it's connected with.

Skellige Expansion: SIREN
Don't be fooled by their beautiful singing. In the high seas, when you hear soothing songs, turn back. Turn back and don't even look around your shoulder.

Legendary Hunt Expansion: KAYRAN
The Kayran laughs at poisons, or it would laugh if it had a sense of humor. Instead, it has long, heavy tentacles, covered in poisoned mucus. Although it looks like a seabound creature, it may travel through rivers and roam the Continent spreading horror.

Mages Expansion: KOSHCHEY
Wizards' dreams of power sometimes take them too far. To the road from which there is no return. Koschey is a magical being, made to serve its powerful master. And to murder... primarily to murder.

Name: 1-Card Joust
Description:
In 1-Card Joust two knights will compete against each other in a joust to see who can either unhorse his opponent or break three lances to win the Joust. Each player will roll dice to determine how many actions they have. They will manipulate the dice by using Yahtzee style combos to increase their number of actions. With these actions they will try to increase their horse speed, maneuver their shield position or correct their lance position while trying to affect their opponents actions.

—description from the designer

Name: Horns of the Buffalo
Description:
Anglo-Zulu War game battle collection with twelve different scenarios.   The combat system is a version of other games by Bill Molyneaux’s games Bloody Mohawk, Savage Wilderness.  The game box will include Isandlwana, Rorkes Drift and other exciting scenarios. 
The scenario list is as follows: Sihayo’s Kraal, Isandlwana, Rorke’s Drift, iNyezane River, Intombi Drift, Ulundi, Ulundi Ambush, Hlobane, Kambula, Buller’s Pursuit, Gingindlovu, Prince Imperial.

—description from the designer

Name: II Grass II Crown
Description:
Over the course of ten battles, The Grass Crown charted the military evolution of the Roman Republic from the days of the manipular Legion and its Triplex Acies formation to the veteran professionals that fought in a series of bloody civil wars. These battles were carefully chosen by designer Amabel Holland with an eye toward only keeping those that would propel the game's central themes forward. Some otherwise compelling, engaging, and interesting battles didn't make that list, either because they made the same "point" as a battle that did make the cut, or they introduced a level of complexity that detracted from the narrative.

You probably see where we're going with this! II Grass II Crown is an expansion that provides eight new scenarios: Beneventum, Metaurus, Ilipa, Great Plains, Cynoscephalae, Magnesia, Zela, and the Cilician Gates. These are aimed at experienced players who don't mind tackling a few extra special rules. Also included is a new countersheet with additional units. Among them are counters for two new unit types, Scythed Chariots and Cataphracted Cavalry, which provide new and daunting challenges.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stalingrad: Operation Winter Storm
Description:
Expansion from "CounterMoves" c2003 regarding attempt to relieve the German 6th Army surrounded at Stalingrad.

Includes 4 pages of history and rules and die cut counter sheet.

Name: The National Game of the American Eagle
Description:
This is a simple spin-and-move game which, like the famous "Mansion of Happiness," adapts the basic format of the 63-space Game of Goose to an Americanized morality theme: in this case, ascending to the American presidency through government. Green spaces are blanks, but white spaces provide some positive or negative quality or trait: "Patriotism," "Firmness," "Hypocrisy," "Duplicity," and so on. An accompanying rulebook provides instructions for most of these spaces, which usually involve advancing or retreating to another space or losing a certain number of turns.

Colored counters (discs) and an 8-sided teetotum are also included.

Name: Jeepers! Creatures!
Description:
Jeepers! Creatures! is a game where 2-4 players take turns spinning to see if they match the bodies and arms of three creatures before everyone else to win the game.

Players spin and if the arrow points to one of their figures. If the spinner does not land on one of their creatures, they pass their turn. However, players that have the spinner land on their space are able to exchange multiple arms depending on if they can match the colored dots on the bottom of the figures and they can combo exchanges together.

The first player to match all three of their monsters with the correct arms wins the game.

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave – Gift Pack
Description:
Enhance any deck with a vast host of universal cards with 10 gambits, 10 upgrades and 12 objectives, you'll be spoiled for choice when constructing your decks.

A printed card dashboard, meanwhile, makes tracking your games simple – just place each of your decks and discard piles in the slots to check your cards at a glance. Use the dashboard to track activations and rounds, and spend less time trying to remember whose turn it is and more time working out deadly strategies! The set includes 3 round tokens for use with the above.

You'll need a copy of the Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave Core Set to use the contents of this pack.

Name: Vendée 93
Description:
At the beginning of 1793, after the execution of King Louis XVI, France was drawn into a war against a coalition of most European monarchies. On 24 February, the National Convention decreed the mass draft of 300,000 men to defend the eastern borders. Throughout the country, revolts broke out against this conscription, everywhere they were brutally repressed with success. However, an insurgent territory, called the "Vendée Militaire" resisted. Determined to engage in a trial of strength with the new revolutionary regime, the Vendéens gradually organised themselves until they formed a "Catholic and Royal Army".
